name: Hanjun Kim 0001
content: Hanjun Kim Hanjun Kim Professor School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Yonsei University Ph.D. 2013, Department of Computer Science, Princeton University Office: Engineering Hall #3-C415 Phone: +82-2-2123-2770 Email: first_name at yonsei.ac.kr [Home] [Curriculum Vitae] [Publications] [CoreLab] [Korean] Research My primary research interests are in compiler optimization, parallel programming and computer architecture. (visit CoreLab for details.) Selected Recognition (see Curriculum Vitae for full list.) Awarded the KIISE/IEEE-CS Young Computer Researcher Award based on the academic achievements on compiler and real-time systems, 2020 Awarded the Intel Corporation Ph.D Fellowship for pursuing leading-edge work in fields related to Intel's business and research interests, 2012 Appointed as a Siebel Scholar based on academic achievement and excellence by the Siebel Scholars Foundation, 2012 Selected Publications (see Publications for full list.) Compiler Optimization for Homomorphic Encryption [IEEE IoT-J 2021] [CGO 2022] [SEC 2023] [ASPLOS 2024] [SEC 2024] High-Level Synthesis [CGO 2021] Real-Time Neural Networks [RTAS 2020] Real-Time IoT Platform [RTAS 2020] [RTSS 2017] IoT Programmability [IEEE IoT-J 2021] [LCTES 2017] [RSP 2017] [IEEE MICRO 2016] Reliable IoT [EMSOFT 2021] [DSN 2018] [SACMAT 2017] Computation Offload (Mobile-Cloud) [CC 2019] [ATC 2018] [MICRO 2015] Parallelism [CGO 2021] [HiPC 2017] [PLDI 2012] [PLDI 2011] [SC 2011] [CGO 2010] Automatic Loop Specialization [ASPLOS 2013] Software Multi-Threaded Transactional Memory Systems [ASPLOS 2010] [MICRO 2010] Current Graduate Students Shinnung Jeong Jaeho Lee Kunwoo Kim Dongkwan Kim Heelim Choi Seonyoung Cheon Sungwoo Yun Ju Min Lee Haeeun Jeong Chan Lee Hoyun Youm Kunmo Jeong Hyunho Kwon Teaching Compiler Design and Optimization: 2018F, 2020F, 2022S Advanced Operating Systems: 2019F, 2021F Microprocessors: 2019F, 2020F Data Structure and Algorithms: 2019S, 2020S, 2021S, 2022S Application Programming: 2018F Introductory Digital Labs: 2019S/F, 2020S/F, 2021S/F, 2022S Management and Revolution of IT Technology: 2019F System Design & Practice: 2021F, 2022S Teaching at POSTECH Compiler Design: 2013F, 2014F, 2015F, 2016S, 2017S, 2018S Parallel Programming: 2014S, 2017S Automata: 2015S Advanced Compiler: 2016S, 2018S Creative IT Design I: 2014S, 2014F, 2016S,	2016F, 2018S Creative IT Design II: 2013F, 2014F, 2015S, 2016F, 2017S Creative IT Design III: 2015S,	2015F, 2017S Creative IT Design IV: 2015F, 2016S
